name: RRB Group D
description: A national-level recruitment examination conducted by the Railway Recruitment Boards (RRBs) on behalf of Railway Recruitment Cells (RRCs) for filling up various Level-1 posts (previously known as Group D) in the Indian Railways. Posts include Track Maintainer Grade-IV, Helper/Assistant in various technical departments, Pointsman, etc.
conductingBody: Railway Recruitment Boards (RRBs) / Railway Recruitment Cells (RRCS)

eligibility.ageLimit: 18 to 33 years. Age relaxation is applicable for candidates belonging to reserved categories (OBC, SC, ST, PwBD) as per government norms.
eligibility.educationalQualification: Class 10th pass (or its equivalent) OR National Apprenticeship Certificate (NAC) granted by NCVT OR ITI from institutions recognised by NCVT/SCVT.
eligibility.nationality: A Citizen of India, or a subject of Nepal, or a subject of Bhutan, or a Tibetan refugee who came over to India before the 1st January 1962.

timeline.notificationDate: The next notification is scheduled to be released between October and December 2024 as per the RRB Annual Calendar. (The last major notification was in February 2019).
timeline.examDate: To be announced. (The last exam was conducted from August 17, 2022, to October 11, 2022).
timeline.resultDate: To be announced after the examination.

stages.name: Stage 1: Computer Based Test (CBT)
stages.description: A single online objective test of 90 minutes duration for 100 questions. The test comprises four sections: General Science, Mathematics, General Intelligence & Reasoning, and General Awareness & Current Affairs.

stages.name: Stage 2: Physical Efficiency Test (PET)
stages.description: Candidates who qualify the CBT are called for PET, which is qualifying in nature. It involves tasks like running a certain distance in a given time and lifting and carrying weight.

stages.name: Stage 3: Document Verification (DV) and Medical Examination
stages.description: Candidates who clear the PET are called for Document Verification. Following DV, candidates undergo a medical fitness test as per railway standards.

examPattern.markingScheme: 1 mark is awarded for each correct answer. 1/3rd of a mark is deducted for each incorrect answer.

syllabus.name: General Science
topics: The syllabus under this shall cover Physics, Chemistry and Life Sciences of the 10th standard level (CBSE).

syllabus.name: General Awareness and Current Affairs
topics: Current Affairs in Science & Technology, Sports, Culture, Personalities, Economics, Politics
Static GK like Geography, History, Indian Polity and Constitution
